title: Bug 35156: Ctrl+F1 not working on all fields in the help search
OB: When using the help search function (Ctrl+F1) in Eclipse with DBCS locale, the Ctrl+F1 shortcut only works on some fields. Pressing Ctrl+F1 on the first text field does not open the help pop-up screen, while pressing Ctrl+F1 on the other fields functions correctly.
EB: Pressing Ctrl+F1 on any field in the help search should open a help pop-up screen displaying information about the selected field.
SR:
To reproduce the issue with Ctrl+F1 not working on all fields in the help search:

1. Launch Eclipse with DBCS locale.
2. Select 'Search' from the menu bar and choose 'Help'.
3. When the help search window opens, click on the first text field. 
4. Press Ctrl+F1.

Expected result: A help pop-up screen should come up displaying information about the selected field. 

Actual result: Nothing happens when Ctrl+F1 is pressed on the first text field. The other fields work properly when Ctrl+F1 is used.
